ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I broadened my knowledge of the Reconciliation Drama canon immensely-- seriously, there were so many plays in this course that I had never heard of before, and I am so glad I got to read them!
Found out what a drama of reconciliation was which was cool

I gained a new understanding of genre and drama theory from this course. I also got very good at analyzing a play through the lens of genre, while also learning how to respond to my classmates effectively. Finally, I learned how to present my thoughts to the class and lead discussion effectively.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Perhaps getting to meet more than once a week, for a shorter time each week, would have enabled us to have a bit more class discussion? I did like the format of the class though.

pretty bog-standard bland lit class, not too jazzy if you've taken a lot of these before. more flexibility to discuss what people care about and not just the 'canon' of reconciliation dramas would be nice

The strength of the course is its syllabus and structure. The plays that we read are, for the most part, very engaging, and theres something new to learn from each of them. Additionally, having weekly discussion posts instead of a final paper allowed for me to continually check in on the themes of the course, instead of trying to cram in final thoughts in the last weeks of class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely-- professor Hagens is a delight, and the material is quite compelling.
yep, it was a good chill time. the self-evaluations were frustrating and not very helpful though

If theyre interested in drama and arent afraid of pushing themselves out of their comfort zone in terms of how much they voice their thoughts in class, Id recommend it. Its a course that demands a high level of attention.
